function_call.name: get_risks
function_call.arguments: {"risks":[{"Description":"Lack of consideration for virus transmission through surface-touching and face-touching behaviors","Impact":"Increased risk of disease transmission in the built environment","Mitigation":"Educating stakeholders about the importance of considering surface-touching and face-touching behaviors in virus transmission","Technologies":"Simulation and modeling technology for virus transmission and contact tracing","People":"Building occupants, infection control specialists","Owner":"Research organizations, public health agencies"},{"Description":"Concerns about the level of randomness in human behaviors in the simulation","Impact":"Uncertainty in modeling real-world human behaviors and their impact on disease transmission","Mitigation":"Conducting multiple simulation runs to minimize the effects of randomness","Technologies":"Simulation and modeling technology for human behaviors","People":"Simulation experts, researchers, health experts","Owner":"Research organizations, simulation technology companies"},{"Description":"Necessity of an explainable interface for OccSim agency","Impact":"Difficulty in understanding and applying human behavior simulation to building design and management","Mitigation":"Developing an easy-to-understand interface for OccSim agency that explains the application of human behaviors to building design","Technologies":"User interface design, simulation visualization tools","People":"Stakeholders not familiar with simulation technology, building designers, facility managers","Owner":"Simulation technology companies, building design firms"}]}
